analytic.title: Verses written by Mr. Laurence Howlet, late Minister of Saint Andrewes Parish in Norwich, sent to the Author foure daies before his Death.

monogr.title: The deuotions of the dying man, that desireth to die well. Deuised and diuulged by Samuel Gardiner Doctor of Diuinitie, and minister of the Church of great St. Peters in Norwich
monogr.author: Gardiner, Samuel

div.head: Verses written by Mr. Laurence Howlet, late Minister of Saint Andrewes Parish in Norwich, sent to the Author foure daies before his Death.
div.l: WHo reades this little book • , may if he can,
Learne the Deuot • ons of a Dying man:
Which hauing learn'd, its know •• dge in such store,
That all the world can teach him nothing more:
Goe little booke; make but thy ti • le true,
Thanke not the world for praise, its but thy due.
